# input_descriptor

**Instance Property**

Descriptors of the input, hidden input, and cell-state input data.

## Declaration

```swift
var input_descriptor: BNNSLSTMDataDescriptor
```

## Discussion

You must define the layout of this descriptor as one of either:

- [doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/BNNSDataLayoutSNE] with the shape ([doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/BNNSLayerParametersLSTM/input_size],[doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/BNNSLayerParametersLSTM/batch_size],[doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/BNNSLayerParametersLSTM/seq_len])
- [doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/BNNSDataLayoutNSE] with the shape  ([doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/BNNSLayerParametersLSTM/input_size],[doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/BNNSLayerParametersLSTM/seq_len],[doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/BNNSLayerParametersLSTM/batch_size])

If you don’t specify a layout, BNNS uses [doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/BNNSDataLayoutSNE].

Use C style multidimensional array notation to define the hierarchy of the [doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/BNNSLSTMDataDescriptor/hidden_desc] and [doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/BNNSLSTMDataDescriptor/cell_state_desc] descriptors as `[num_layers][num_directions][batch_size][hidden_size]`.

If [doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/BNNSLayerParametersLSTM/lstm_flags] includes [doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/BNNSLayerFlagsLSTMBidirectional], BNNS defines `num_directions` as `2`, or otherwise `1`.

If the corresponding data of the [doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/BNNSLSTMDataDescriptor/hidden_desc] and [doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/BNNSLSTMDataDescriptor/cell_state_desc] descriptors is `nil`, BNNS treats their [doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/BNNSLayerParametersLSTM/input_descriptor] as zero-filled arrays.

## Instance Properties

- **input_size**: The number of elements in the input.
- **hidden_size**: The number of elements in the hidden state.
- **batch_size**: The number of input and output samples.
- **num_layers**: The number of stacked long short-term memory (LSTM) layers.
- **seq_len**: The size of the sequential input.
- **dropout**: The dropout ratio to apply between long short-term memory (LSTM) layers.
- **lstm_flags**: Flags that control the behavior of a long short-term memory (LSTM) layer.
- **sequence_descriptor**: A 1D array of unsigned-integer elements that determines the batch size for each step.
- **output_descriptor**: Descriptors of the output, hidden output, and cell-state output data.
- **input_gate**: The descriptor of the input gate, which uses default sigmoid activation.
- **forget_gate**: The descriptor of the forget gate, which uses default sigmoid activation.
- **candidate_gate**: The descriptor of the candidate gate, which uses default tanh activation.
- **output_gate**: The descriptor of the output gate, which uses default sigmoid activation.
- **hidden_activation**: Hidden activation function, which uses default tanh activation.
